properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 3:16AM EST until January 19 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...SNOW EXPECTED LATE TODAY INTO SUNDAY MORNING...

low pressure moving out of the Great Lakes region will spread
snow into the area. The snow could be heavy at times, mainly
this evening. The will taper off to snow showers from west to east
late tonight through Sunday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches expected. For the Wind
Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as
30 below zero.

* WHERE...Northern Franklin and Central Somerset Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM this evening
to noon EST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 7 AM
EST this morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind
chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as
30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to
www.weather.gov/gray..

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST SUNDAY
